channel.title: Packing an exe into a jar file
channel.description:
What I want to do seems possible, but before I go ahead and give it a go, just wanted some opinions/answers from those who know what they're doing.
Is it possible to encrypt an exe file and just store it in a random file. Pack this random file into the jar, and then when the jar is executed, the bytes are decrypted and written to a directory, which would produce the original .exe file

item.title: Packing an exe into a jar file
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Davidi2:

There’s no reason to encrypt them or anything like that, if your intentions are what you mean why can’t you just rar them or something?

Yeah that’s how it is at the moment, but it’s a confusing set up.

Just thought it would come in handy if everything was done when opening a jar file.

[quote=“imthenull, post:7, topic:507695”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=625931.msg4258740#msg4258740 date=1363205916]
It’s for exploits in other games such as call of duty etc…

There are a lot of .exe files and I thought it would be easier to load them on one click.

Alright then thanks, I’ll give it a go.
[/quote]
If those are your true intentions then an easy way to do this is to use my JAG CACHE project, which allows you to compress multiple files into a single archive using the BZIP2 compression. It also has the ability to decompress archives. You can find the thread here[/quote]

Thanks I’ll take a look.

Read full topic
item.source: Packing an exe into a jar file

item.title: Packing an exe into a jar file
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:5, topic:507695”]It’s for exploits in other games such as call of duty etc…

There are a lot of .exe files and I thought it would be easier to load them on one click.

Alright then thanks, I’ll give it a go.[/quote]
If those are your true intentions then an easy way to do this is to use my JAG CACHE project, which allows you to compress multiple files into a single archive using the BZIP2 compression. It also has the ability to decompress archives. You can find the thread here

Read full topic

item.title: Packing an exe into a jar file
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:4, topic:507695”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=625931.msg4258737#msg4258737 date=1363205661]

In other words you want to put a virus into your program subtly

I guess that would open that door…

But it wasn’t meant to be malicious.
[/quote]Then what’s the point. And of course it’s possible, it’s actually easy.[/quote]

It’s for exploits in other games such as call of duty etc…

There are a lot of .exe files and I thought it would be easier to load them on one click.

Alright then thanks, I’ll give it a go.

Read full topic
